item.title:
Have you ever wondered what the Tesla logo means?
It's the cross-section of an electric motor. The main body of the "T" represents one of the poles that protrude from the rotor of a motor, while the second line on top represents a piece of the stator
https://t.co/nmf7Efuay7. https://t.co/2pufvEEAUD https://t.co/CvjLTlbV4l

item.title: @tyrell_turing @hardmaru Mmmm how good is SGD to initialize in your opinion? I feel like evolution provides the initialization framework that is necessary to find the solution islands. Once your are hooked onto a potential solution, it could be slower, yes.
item.description: @tyrell_turing @hardmaru Mmmm how good is SGD to initialize in your opinion? I feel like evolution provides the initialization framework that is necessary to find the solution islands. Once your are hooked onto a potential solution, it could be slower, yes.
item.content:encoded: @tyrell_turing @hardmaru Mmmm how good is SGD to initialize in your opinion? I feel like evolution provides the initialization framework that is necessary to find the solution islands. Once your are hooked onto a potential solution, it could be slower, yes.

item.title: @LecoqJerome @hardmaru I think it would still be better. Initialization in large, flat minima would be good, and SGD would get you there faster. I don't see any reason why evolution would produce better initializations...
item.description: @LecoqJerome @hardmaru I think it would still be better. Initialization in large, flat minima would be good, and SGD would get you there faster. I don't see any reason why evolution would produce better initializations...
